points: Integration across planning, execution, and control is emphasized by all.
Alignment to objectives/benefits and governance is a common thread.
Tailoring integration to delivery approach and context is supported.
All emphasize early identification of stakeholders and continuous engagement.
Clear roles, responsibilities, and communication channels are encouraged.
Expectations alignment and feedback loops are considered essential.
Defining deliverables/outcomes and acceptance criteria is common across the standards.
Progressive elaboration and change control are recognized practices.
Decomposition (e.g., work/products) is used to structure scope.
Activity definition, sequencing, and estimation inform schedule creation.
Baselines and periodic control/updates are expected.
Tailoring of scheduling techniques to delivery approach is supported.
Cost estimation, budgeting, and control are foundational practices.
Baseline management and variance analysis are recognized.
Benefits/value alignment influences cost decisions.
Planning, assurance, and control activities are recommended for quality.
Quality criteria/requirements should be defined and verified.
Continuous improvement and lessons learned are encouraged.
Acquire, develop, and manage resources to meet project needs.
Team roles and competencies are recognized as critical.
Resource planning aligns with schedule and scope.
Plan and manage information distribution to stakeholders.
Transparency and timely reporting are emphasized.
Two-way feedback mechanisms are valued.
Plan procurement, select suppliers, and administer contracts.
Contract type and relationship management impact outcomes.
Governance oversight for commercial decisions is present.
Each standard requires a structured approach to identifying, analyzing, and responding to risks.
Ongoing monitoring, ownership assignment, and communication of risks are recommended.
Both threats and opportunities are recognized as part of uncertainty management.
Formal evaluation of changes against baselines is expected.
Impact analysis and authorization precede implementation.
Configuration control supports traceability.
Role clarity and decision rights are emphasized.
Escalation paths and oversight mechanisms exist.
Governance aligns projects to strategy and benefits.
Benefits and value realization are tracked across the lifecycle.
Business case/justification aligns to organizational strategy.
Measurement and learning inform ongoing decisions.
